meanings: [명사] abandonment, (권리·지위 등의) (formal) renunciation, [동사] give up (on), abandon, (formal) renounce
back out of a(n) game[event, match]

examples.korean: She was not going to give up her hard-won freedom so easily. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 그녀는 어렵게 얻은 자신의 자유를 그렇게 쉽게 포기할 생각이 없었다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: She was not going to give up her hard-won freedom so easily. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: Many of life's failures are those who didn't know how close they were to success when they gave up. (Thomas A. Edison) 듣기 Add to Wordbook 많은 인생의 실패자들은 포기할 때 자신이 성공에서 얼마나 가까이 있었는지 모른다. (토마스 A. 에디슨, 실패명언) 명언/속담
examples.english: Many of life's failures are those who didn't know how close they were to success when they gave up. (Thomas A. Edison) Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: Celebrities have not abandoned lip fillers. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 유명인들은 립필러를 포기할 줄 모른다. 국제영어대학원대학교 신어사전
examples.english: Celebrities have not abandoned lip fillers. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: I have opiophobia, so I will give up being treated with opiates. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 저는 아편 공포증이 있어서 아편 치료받는 것을 포기할 것이에요. 국제영어대학원대학교 신어사전
examples.english: I have opiophobia, so I will give up being treated with opiates. Add to Wordbook
